story.title: UX Design System Foundation
story.i-want: to establish the visual foundation of the application using the shadcn/ui design system
story.so-that: all subsequent UI components are built with a consistent, professional, and accessible aesthetic that promotes a calm and focused user experience

acceptance-criteria.criterion: shadcn/ui Integration: Given the project is set up with React and Tailwind CSS, when the developer runs the shadcn/ui initialization command, then all necessary configuration files are created and correctly configured, and the Button component can be added and rendered successfully.

Theme and Color System Implementation: Given the ux-design-specification.md defines the color palette, when the developer configures the Tailwind CSS theme, then all colors are available as CSS variables and utility classes, verified by a test page.

Typography System Setup: Given the ux-design-specification.md defines the fonts and type scale, when the developer configures the Tailwind CSS theme, then the correct fonts and type scale classes are available, verified by a test page.

Spacing, Shadows, and Border Radius Configuration: Given the ux-design-specification.md defines the spacing, shadow, and border radius systems, when the developer configures the Tailwind CSS theme, then these systems are available as utility classes, verified by a test page.

Base Component Styling: Given shadcn/ui is initialized and the theme is configured, when the developer adds base components, then they automatically adopt the custom theme without manual overrides, verified by checking a Button, Card, and Input component.

tasks.task: Install and initialize Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui.
Configure the full color, typography, and spacing systems in tailwind.config.js.
Add and visually verify Button, Input, Card, and Badge components on a test page.
Create DESIGN_SYSTEM.md to document the theme and component usage.

doc.title: hl7-capture UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Chosen System: shadcn/ui. Provides the ideal balance for hl7-capture between professional quality and complete customization control. Components are copied directly into your project, giving you full ownership.

doc.title: Technical Specification: HL7-Capture
doc.snippet: Establishes the foundational tech stack and conventions for the project, including TypeScript strict mode, 2-space indentation, and the file organization structure.

code.reason: The root React component where the design system will be applied.
The existing global stylesheet. The new Tailwind CSS utility classes will supersede the styles in this file for new components.

constraints.constraint: Follow the file organization pattern defined in the tech-spec (e.g., `src/renderer/components`).
Use TypeScript strict mode and adhere to the established code style (2-space indentation, double quotes).
New components should be created using the shadcn/ui CLI to ensure they are correctly added to the project.

tests.standards: Use Jest and @testing-library/react for component testing. Tests should be co-located with the source files in a `__tests__` directory or with a `.test.ts` extension. Aim for 80%+ test coverage on business logic.

ideas.idea: Write a test to ensure the `Button` component from shadcn/ui can be rendered without errors after initialization.
Create a test that renders a component with a themed background color and asserts that the computed style matches the correct hex code from the design system.
Write a snapshot test for the `DesignSystemTestPage.tsx` component to ensure all base components render correctly with the applied theme.
